sentence.text: Lopressor, metoprolol tartrate USP, is a selective beta1-adrenoreceptor blocking agent, available as 50- and 100-mg tablets for oral administration and in 5-mL ampuls for intravenous administration.
Each ampul contains a sterile solution of metoprolol tartrate USP, 5 mg, and sodium chloride USP, 45 mg, and water for injection USP.

mmtx.phraseText: a sterile solution of metoprolol tartrate USP,

sentence.text: Metoprolol tartrate USP is ( )-1-(Isopropylamino)-3- p -(2-methoxyethyl)phenoxy -2-propanol L-(+)-tartrate (2:1) salt, and its structural formula is
It is very soluble in water, freely soluble in methylene chloride, in chloroform, and in alcohol, slightly soluble in acetone, and insoluble in ether.
Inactive Ingredients : Tablets contain cellulose compounds, colloidal silicon dioxide, D - C Red No.
2 aluminum lake (100-mg tablets), lactose, magnesium stearate, polyethylene glycol, propylene glycol, povidone, sodium starch glycolate, talc, and titanium dioxide.
Hypersensitivity to Lopressor and related derivatives, or to any of the excipients, hypersensitivity to other beta blockers (cross sensitivity between beta blockers can occur).
Catecholamine-depleting drugs: Catecholamine-depleting drugs (e.g., reserpine) may have an additive effect when given with beta-blocking agents or monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibitors.
Observe patients treated with Lopressor plus a catecholamine depletor for evidence of hypotension or marked bradycardia, which may produce vertigo, syncope, or postural hypotension.
In addition, possibly significant hypertension may theoretically occur up to 14 days following discontinuation of the concomitant administration with an irreversible MAO inhibitor.

ellipsisSentence.text: Observe patients treated with Lopressor plus a catecholamine depletor for evidence of hypotension or marked bradycardia, which may produce vertigo, syncope, or postural hypotension.

sentence.text: Digitalis glycosides and beta blockers: Both digitalis glycosides and beta blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.
Concomitant use can increase the risk of bradycardia.

ellipsisSentence.text: Digitalis glycosides and beta blockers: Both digitalis glycosides and beta blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.
Digitalis glycosides and beta blockers: Both digitalis glycosides and beta blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.

sentence.text: Monitor heart rate and PR interval.

ellipsisSentence.text: Digitalis glycosides and beta blockers: Both digitalis glycosides and beta blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.

middleSentence.text: Concomitant use can increase the risk of bradycardia.

ellipsisSentence.text: Digitalis glycosides and beta blockers: Both digitalis glycosides and beta blockers slow atrioventricular conduction and decrease heart rate.

middleSentence.text: Concomitant use can increase the risk of bradycardia.

sentence.text: Calcium channel blockers: Concomitant administration of a beta-adrenergic antagonist with a calcium channel blocker may produce an additive reduction in myocardial contractility because of negative chronotropic and inotropic effects.

mmtx.phraseText: Concomitant administration of a beta-adrenergic antagonist

sentence.text: Risk of Anaphylactic Reaction : While taking beta blockers, patients with a history of severe anaphylactic reaction to a variety of allergens may be more reactive to repeated challenge, either accidental, diagnostic, or therapeutic.
General Anesthetics: Some inhalation anesthetics may enhance the cardiodepressant effect of beta blockers (see WARNINGS, Major Surgery).

mmtx.phraseText: the cardiodepressant effect of beta blockers

sentence.text: CYP2D6 Inhibitors: Potent inhibitors of the CYP2D6 enzyme may increase the plasma concentration of Lopressor which would mimic the pharmacokinetics of CYP2D6 poor metabolizer (see Pharmacokinetics section).

entity.text: Potent inhibitors of the CYP2D6 enzyme

mmtx.phraseText: Potent inhibitors of the CYP2D6 enzyme

sentence.text: Known clinically significant potent inhibitors of CYP2D6 are antidepressants such as fluvoxamine, fluoxetine, paroxetine, sertraline,bupropion, clomipramine, and desipramine, antipsychotics such as chlorpromazine, fluphenazine, haloperidol, and thioridazine, antiarrhythmics such as quinidine or propafenone, antiretrovirals such as ritonavir, antihistamines such as diphenhydramine, antimalarials such as hydroxychloroquine or quinidine, antifungals such as terbinafine.
Hydralazine: Concomitant administration of hydralazine may inhibit presystemic metabolism of metoprolol leading to increased concentrations of metoprolol.

mmtx.phraseText: leading to increased concentrations of metoprolol.

sentence.text: Alpha-adrenergic agents: Antihypertensive effect of alpha-adrenergic blockers such as guanethidine, betanidine, reserpine, alpha-methyldopa or clonidine may be potentiated by beta-blockers including Lopressor.
Beta- adrenergic blockers may also potentiate the postural hypotensive effect of the first dose of prazosin, probably by preventing reflex tachycardia.

mmtx.phraseText: the postural hypotensive effect of the first dose of prazosin,

sentence.text: On the contrary, beta adrenergic blockers may also potentiate the hypertensive response to withdrawal of clonidine in patients receiving concomitant clonidine and beta-adrenergic blocker.

mmtx.phraseText: the hypertensive response to withdrawal of clonidine

sentence.text: If a patient is treated with clonidine and Lopressor concurrently, and clonidine treatment is to be discontinued, stop Lopressor several days before clonidine is withdrawn.

mmtx.phraseText: stop Lopressor several days before clonidine
stop Lopressor several days before clonidine

sentence.text: Rebound hypertension that can follow withdrawal of clonidine may be increased in patients receiving concurrent beta-blocker treatment.
Ergot alkaloid: Concomitant administration with beta-blockers may enhance the vasoconstrictive action of ergot alkaloids.

mmtx.phraseText: the vasoconstrictive action of ergot alkaloids.

sentence.text: Dipyridamole: In general, administration of a beta-blocker should be withheld before dipyridamole testing, with careful monitoring of heart rate following the dipyridamole injection.
The usual initial dosage of Lopressor tablets is 100 mg daily in single or divided doses, whether used alone or added to a diuretic.

mmtx.phraseText: The usual initial dosage of Lopressor tablets

sentence.text: Although the efficacy of Lopressor beyond 3 months has not been conclusively established, data from studies with other beta blockers suggest that treatment should be continued for 1-3 years.
